translated: Elder’s Birth Stories🔽The Chapter with Umāpupphiya

analyzed: anna sa sāva kattheḥ a padāna
translated: The Elder Annasaṁsāvaka’s Birth Story
“The One with Golden Skin, the Awakened One,
was walking along in the middle of the road;
Shining like a golden lamp,
with the thirty-two marks of a great man.
Siddhattha, the one who has accomplished all,
the one who is not agitated, the undefeated one;
I served the Awakened One,
the Great Sage.
The Sage, the compassionate one in the world,
illuminated me then.
Having purified my mind towards the Buddha,
I rejoiced in heaven for an eon.
For ninety-four eons,
the gift I gave then;
I do not know of a bad destination,
this is the fruit of giving to a monk.
The four analytical insights,
I have done what the Buddha asked.”

original: Itthaṁ sudaṁ āyasmā annasaṁsāvako thero imā gāthāyo abhāsitthāti.
analyzed: ittham sudam āyasmai annasasāvakaḥ theraḥ imāḥ gāthāyaḥ abhāsittha ati
translated: Thus the elder Annasaṁsāvaka recited these verses.
The Elder Annasaṁsāvaka’s Birth Story, the sixth.
